cards.title: Intro
cards.body: The [Hook](https://github.com/hook-lang/hook/) cheat sheet is a one-page reference sheet for the Hook programming language.

cards.title: What does Hook look like?
What does Hook look like?
cards.body: Hook features a modern syntax similar to `C`.

cards.title: Hello, world!
cards.code:
println('Hello, World!');
// Hello, World!

cards.title: Hello, world!
cards.body: The `Hello, World!` program in Hook.

cards.title: Installing with Homebrew
cards.code:
brew tap hook-lang/hook
brew install hook
hook --help

cards.title: Installing with Homebrew
cards.body: The interpreter is available on [`Homebrew`](https://brew.sh).

cards.title: Installing on Windows
cards.code:
cd %tmp%
curl -sSLO https://raw.githubusercontent.com/hook-lang/hook/main/scripts/install.bat
install

cards.title: Installing on Windows
cards.body: This is how you can install it on `Windows`.

cards.title: Basic Types
cards.body: List of basic types.

cards.title: Bool
cards.code:
let x = true;
let y = false;

cards.title: Bool
cards.body: Bool is a boolean type. So, it can be `true` or `false`.

cards.title: Numbers
Numbers
cards.body: Numbers can be integers or floating-point.

cards.title: Strings
Strings
cards.body: Strings can be single or double-quoted.

cards.title: Ranges
Ranges
cards.body: Ranges are a sequence of integers.

cards.title: Arrays
Arrays
cards.body: Arrays are a sequence of elements.

cards.title: Records
Records
cards.body: Records maps fields to values.

cards.title: The **nil** value
cards.code:
let x = nil;
var y;

cards.title: The **nil** value
cards.code:
println(x); // nil
println(y); // nil

cards.title: The **nil** value
cards.body: `nil` is the absence of a value.

cards.title: Falsy values
cards.code:
if (nil) "true" else "false";   // false
if (false) "true" else "false"; // false
if (true) "true" else "false";  // true
if (0) "true" else "false";     // true
if (1) "true" else "false";     // true
if ("") "true" else "false";    // true
if ([]) "true" else "false";    // true
if ({}) "true" else "false";    // true

cards.title: Falsy values
cards.body: Just `nil` and `false` are falsy.

cards.title: Comments
Comments
cards.body: Hook supports single-line comments only. Sorry!

cards.title: Semi-colons
Semi-colons
cards.body: Semi-colons are required and empty statements are not allowed.

cards.title: Blocks
Blocks
cards.body: Blocks are used to define a scope.

cards.title: Reserved words
cards.body: There are few reserved words.

cards.title: Identifiers
Identifiers
cards.body: Identifiers are case-sensitive.

cards.title: Variables
cards.code:
var x; // x contains nil
x = 5; // now, x contains a number
x = 'foo'; // a string

println(x);

cards.title: Variables
cards.body: Values have types, but variables don't.

cards.title: Immutable variables
Immutable variables
cards.body: Immutable variables must be initialized when declared.

cards.title: Scopes
Scopes
cards.body: When a heap-allocated variable goes out of scope, it is automatically deallocated.

cards.title: Shadowing
Shadowing
cards.body: Variables can be shadowed.

cards.title: Arithmetic
cards.body: The basic arithmetic operators.

cards.title: Comparison
cards.code:
println(5 == 10); // false
println(5 != 10); // true
println(5 < 10); // true
println(5 > 10); // false
println(5 <= 10); // true
println(5 >= 10); // false

cards.title: Comparison
cards.body: The comparison operators.

cards.title: Logical
cards.code:
println(true && false); // false
println(true || false); // true
println(!true); // false

cards.title: Logical
cards.body: The logical operators.

cards.title: Bitwise and shift
cards.code:
println(5 & 10); // 0
println(5 | 10); // 15
println(5 ^ 10); // 15
println(~5); // -6
println(5 << 1); // 10
println(5 >> 1); // 2

cards.title: Bitwise and shift
cards.body: The bitwise and shift operators.

cards.title: Assignments
cards.body: The assignment operators.

cards.title: Teh ternary operator
Teh ternary operator
cards.body: In Hook, the ternary operator is `if else`.

cards.title: If
If
cards.body: The `if` statement.

cards.title: If else
If else
cards.body: The `if else` statement.

cards.title: Match
Match
cards.body: The `match` statement.

cards.title: While
While
cards.body: The `while` loop.

cards.title: Do while
Do while
cards.body: The `do while` loop.

cards.title: For
For
cards.body: The classic `for` loop.

cards.title: Loop
Loop
cards.body: The unconditional `loop`.

cards.title: Break
cards.code: var i = 0;

cards.title: Break
Break
cards.body: Use `break` to exit a loop.

cards.title: Continue
cards.code: var i = 0;

cards.title: Continue
Continue
cards.body: Use `continue` to skip the rest of the loop body.

cards.title: Indexing a string
cards.code:
let s = 'Hello';

println(s[0]); // H
println(s[1]); // e
println(s[4]); // o

cards.title: Indexing a string
cards.body: Indexing a string returns a 1-character string.

cards.title: Slicing a string
Slicing a string
cards.body: Pass a range to slice a string.

cards.title: Concatening strings
Concatening strings
cards.body: Use the `+` operator to concatenate strings.

cards.title: Indexing an array
cards.code:
let a = [1, 2, 3];

println(a[0]); // 1
println(a[1]); // 2
println(a[2]); // 3

cards.title: Indexing an array
cards.body: Indexing an array returns an element.

cards.title: Slicing an array
cards.body: Arrays are zero-indexed.

cards.title: Appending an element
cards.body: Arrays are mutable. Use `[]` to append an element.

cards.title: Element assignment
cards.body: Update an element in an array.

cards.title: Concatening arrays
Concatening arrays
cards.body: Use the `+` operator to concatenate arrays.

cards.title: Subtracting arrays
Subtracting arrays
cards.body: Get the difference between two arrays.

cards.title: Function declaration
Function declaration
cards.body: Functions are first-class citizens.

cards.title: Function call
Function call
cards.body: The number of arguments is adjusted.

cards.title: Anonymous functions
Anonymous functions
cards.body: Anonymous functions are also supported.

cards.title: Closures
cards.code: let pi = 3.14;

cards.title: Closures
Closures
cards.body: Closures in Hook capture values only.

cards.title: Higher-order functions
Higher-order functions
cards.body: Functions can be passed as arguments or returned.

cards.title: Syntax sugar for functions
Syntax sugar for functions
cards.body: Use `=>` when the body is a single expression.

cards.title: Recursion
Recursion
cards.body: Recursion is supported.

cards.title: Built-in functions
Built-in functions
cards.body: There are many built-in functions.

cards.title: More built-in functions
cards.body: See: [Built-in Functions](https://github.com/hook-lang/hook/blob/main/docs/built-in.md)

cards.title: Structs
Structs
Structs
cards.body: A struct is a prototype for a record.

cards.title: Accessing fields
cards.code:
println(p.x); // 5
println(p.y); // 10

cards.title: Accessing fields
cards.body: Use `.` to access a field in a record.

cards.title: Field assignment
cards.body: Update a value of a field in a record.

cards.title: Destructuring an array
Destructuring an array
cards.body: Varuables are declared and assigned.

cards.title: Destructuring a record
Destructuring a record
cards.body: Use `{}` to destructure a record.

cards.title: Placeholder
Placeholder
cards.body: Use `_` skip leading or middle elements.

cards.title: Importing a module
cards.code: import math;

cards.title: Importing a module
cards.code:
println(math.sqrt(25));
// 5

cards.title: Importing a module
cards.body: Use `import` to bring a module into scope.

cards.title: Exporting symbols
Exporting symbols
cards.body: Return a record with the symbols to export.

cards.title: Importing local modules
cards.code: import "./my_module.hk" as my;

cards.title: Importing local modules
cards.code:
println(my.useful());
// Nothing

cards.title: Importing local modules
cards.body: Specify the path to the local module.

cards.title: Selective import
Selective import
cards.body: Use `{}` to import specific symbols.

cards.title: Errors
Errors
cards.body: Hook uses panic mode for error handling. When an error occurs, the interpreter stops.

cards.title: Syntax error
Syntax error
cards.body: Hook has a strict syntax.

cards.title: Panic
Panic
cards.body: Use the `panic` built-in function to raise an error.

cards.title: Assert
Assert
cards.body: Use the `assert` built-in function to check a condition.

cards.title: Returning errors
Returning errors
cards.body: Use a pair to return a value and an error.

Passing errors
